page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: Guardbridge is located in North East Fife, at the head of the Eden Estuary, where the River Eden flows into the sea. It is a small village of 850 people and is surrounded by pleasantly rural countryside, containing several large prosperous farms. Four miles to the east lies the University town of St Andrews, while north across the Firth of Tay is the city of Dundee. Guardbridge lies along the busy routeway linking these two settlements. The village is dominated by a large and thriving paper mill which is sited at the north of the River Eden. The water here is used in the paper making process and for the disposal of waste products and is therefore discoloured. The paper mill is a major employer in the area.
